intro: Cyclophorus spicatus, commonly known as the spiny cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
